{{Infobox football biography | name = Victorien Angban | image = RC Lens - FC Metz (09-02-2019) 44.jpg | image_size = 280 | caption = Angban in 2019 with Metz. | fullname = Bekanty Victorien Angban{{cite web|title=Premier League - Squad List 2015/16|url=http://www.premierleague.com/content/dam/premierleague/site-content/News/publications/squad-lists/Premier-League-squad-lists-September-2015.pdf|publisher=Premier League|format=PDF|page=8|accessdate=23 September 2015}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1996|09|29|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Abidjan]], Ivory Coast | height = {{height|m=1.80}} | position = [[Midfielder]] | currentclub = [[FC Metz|Metz]]
(on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]) | clubnumber = 5 | youthyears1 = 2010–2015 |youthclubs1 = [[Stade d'Abidjan]] | years1 = 2015– | clubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | caps1 = 0 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2015–2016 | clubs2 = → [[Sint-Truidense V.V.|Sint-Truiden]] (loan) | caps2 = 23 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2016–2017 | clubs3 = → [[Granada CF|Granada]] (loan) | caps3 = 10 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2017–2018 | clubs4 = → [[Waasland-Beveren]] (loan) | caps4 = 25 | goals4 = 1 | years5 = 2018– | clubs5 = → [[FC Metz|Metz]] (loan) | caps5 = 18 | goals5 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2013–2014 | nationalteam1 = [[Ivory Coast national under-17 football team|Ivory Coast U17]] | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2015 | nationalteam2 = [[Ivory Coast national under-20 football team|Ivory Coast U20]] | nationalcaps2 = 2 | nationalgoals2 = 1 | nationalyears3 = 2015– | nationalteam3 = [[Ivory Coast national football team|Ivory Coast]] | nationalcaps3 = 7 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | pcupdate = 23 February 2019 | ntupdate = 14:41, 18 December 2018 (UTC) }} '''Bekanty Victorien Angban''' (born 29 September 1996) is an Ivorian professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder|central midfielder]] or [[Midfielder|winger]] for [[FC Metz|Metz]] on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]. ==Club career== ===Chelsea=== In 2012, Angban joined [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] from [[Stade d'Abidjan]] as a trialist. He only officially signed for Chelsea in 2015, after he was able to obtain a work permit after spending three years in the country.{{Cite news |title=Victorien Angban - TheChels.info - The Chelsea Football Club Wiki |url=http://thechels.info/wiki/Victorien_Angban|publisher=TheChels.info}} ====Loan to Sint-Truiden==== On 14 July 2015, it was announced that Angban would spend the season on loan at [[Belgium|Belgian]] club [[Sint-Truidense V.V.|Sint-Truiden]].{{Cite news |title=Loan for young midfielder |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2015/07/loan-for-young-midfielder.html |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=14 July 2015}} On 24 July 2015, Angban made his professional debut as a 64th-minute substitute in a 2-1 victory over [[Club Brugge KV|Club Brugge]] in their first game of the season.{{Cite news |title=Belgium Pro League: STVV - Club Brugge - FIFA.com |url=https://www.fifa.com/world-match-centre/nationalleagues/nationalleague=belgium-pro-league-2000000009/matches/match=stvv-club-brugge-300325171/index.html |publisher=FIFA|date=24 July 2015}} Angban made his first start for the team on 8 August, against [[K.V. Oostende]] which ended in a 1-1 draw.{{Cite |title=STVV 1-1 K.V. Oostende |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/08/08/belgium/pro-league/sint-truidense-vv/kv-oostende/2038964/ |publisher=Soccerway|date=8 August 2015}} On 27 September 2015, Angban was sent off in the 79th minute in the game against [[R.S.C. Anderlecht]] in a 1–0 loss.{{Cite |title=Anderlecht 1-0 STVV |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/09/27/belgium/pro-league/royal-sporting-club-anderlecht/sint-truidense-vv/2039009/ |publisher=Soccerway|date=27 September 2015}} On 29 January 2016, Angban was again sent off in a match against Anderlecht in the closing minutes of a 2–1 loss.{{Cite |title=STVV 1-2 Anderlecht |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2016/01/29/belgium/pro-league/sint-truidense-vv/royal-sporting-club-anderlecht/2039136/ |publisher=Soccerway|date=29 January 2016}} On 5 March 2016, Angban was sent off for the third time this season a match against [[Club Brugge KV]] after picking up two yellows; the match ended in a 3–0 loss for Sint-Truiden.{{Cite |title=Club Brugge 3-0 STVV |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2016/03/05/belgium/pro-league/club-brugge-kv/sint-truidense-vv/2039169/ |publisher=Soccerway|date=5 March 2016 }} At the end of the season, Angban picked up a total of 8 yellow cards and was sent off a total of 3 times. ====Loan to Granada==== On 22 July 2016, it was announced that Angban will be joining [[Spain|Spanish]] side [[Granada CF|Granada]] on loan for the season. Angban is the second Chelsea player to join Granada on loan, with the first being [[Jérémie Boga]].{{cite web|url=http://www.granadacf.es/noticia/angban-musculo-para-la-medular-granadinista?platform=hootsuite|title=Angban, músculo para la medular granadinista |publisher=Granada CF |date=22 July 2016}} On 16 September 2016, Angban made his debut in a 2–2 draw against [[Real Betis]].{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2016/09/16/spain/primera-division/real-betis/granada-club-de-futbol/2282941/ |title=Real Betis vs. Granada 2 - 2 (2016/09/16) |date=16 September 2016}} ====Loan to Waasland-Beveren==== On 28 July 2017, it was announced that Angban will be joining Belgian side [[Waasland-Beveren]] on loan for the season.{{cite web|url=http://www.waasland-beveren.be/2017/07/waasland-beveren-versterkt-zich-victorien-angban/|title=WAASLAND-BEVEREN VERSTERKT ZICH MET VICTORIEN ANGBAN|publisher=Waasland-Beveren |date=28 July 2017}} ====Loan to FC Metz==== In July 2018, it was announced that Angban will be joining FC Metz in French second tier on loan for the season.{{Cite news|url=http://www.fcmetz.com/2018-2019/actualites/equipe-pro/victorien-angban-arrive-en-pret|title=Victorien Angban arrive en prêt !|last=sgobbi|date=2018-07-27|work=Football Club de Metz|access-date=2018-08-25|language=fr}} == International career == Angban has represented Ivory Coast at U17 level. Angban represented his nation and scored at the 2015 African Under-20 Championship finals.{{Cite web|title = Bekanty Victorien Angban|url = https://www.chelseafc.com/teams/on-loan-players/bekanty-victorien-angban.html|website = www.chelseafc.com|accessdate = 2015-08-08}} On 2 October 2015, Angban received his first senior Ivory Coast call up by manager [[Michel Dussuyer]] as they took on [[Morocco national football team|Morocco]] in a friendly.{{Cite news |title=Ivory Coast decline to call up star City pair |url=http://m.news24.com/sport24/soccer/englishpremiership/toure-bony-not-on-ivory-coast-duty-20151002 |publisher=sport24 |date=2 October 2015}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|23 February
